metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3226 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in json/encoding.rb in Active Support in Ruby on Rails 3.x and 4.1.x before 4.1.11 and 4.2.x before 4.2.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted Hash that is mishandled during JSON encoding.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-actionpack - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-actionview - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-activejob - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-activemodel - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-activerecord - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-activesupport - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-rails - 2:4.2.5-1
ruby-railties - 2:4.2.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> in Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition

criterions.comment: rails package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.2.5-1').
